instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.

threads.title: Macbook air 13, 820 3437 B, liquid damage ,No turn On
threads.message:
hey guys, 

I have a doubt, this boar come to us because a liqued damage close to <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> and the components <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7081</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7080</CAPACITOR> they are not in board.. its normal??  

I have a 0.4v in pin8 <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> . need 3.4v in SHDN to be able P3V42G3H ?

threads.title: Macbook air 13, 820 3437 B, liquid damage ,No turn On
Macbook air 13, 820 3437 B, liquid damage ,No turn On
threads.message:
[QUOTE="arghhh, post: 10883"]<RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> should be there. Replace it.[/QUOTE]

Just checked a couple of working boards. <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> is not present on any of them.

threads.title: Macbook air 13, 820 3437 B, liquid damage ,No turn On
threads.message: Yeah <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> needs to be there to enable <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>, the other two are "no stuff" so not populated.
